elements.text: 26:63-65 The execution of the sentence passed on the murmurers, chap. 14:29, is observable. There was not one man numbered now, who was numbered then, but Caleb and Joshua. Here appeared the righteousness of God, and his faithfulness to his threatenings. Especially observe the truth of God, in performing his promise to Caleb and Joshua. Death makes awful havoc of the human species, and causes surprising changes in families and nations; yet all is appointed in perfect wisdom, justice, and truth, by the Lord himself. This should stir us up to think upon the hateful nature of sin, the cause of all these devastations. We should renew our repentance, seek forgiveness, value the salvation of Christ, remember how frail we are, prepare for the summons of death, and fill up our days in serving our generation according to the will of God.
The total number of male Levites, 23,000, shows an increase of 1,000 on the number at Sinai
Numbers 3:39
. It is doubtless to be taken as a round number; and, as before, includes the male children from a month old and upward, as well as the male adults.
62. twenty and three thousand—so that there was an increase of a thousand (Nu 3:39).
males from a month old and upward—(See on [93]Nu 3:14).
No text from Poole on this verse.

name: Gill's Exposition of the Entire Bible

elements.text: These are they that were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest,.... That is, these were the Levites, their families, and the number of males in them, which was taken by Moses and Eleazar, who might be only concerned in numbering the Levites, of which tribe they were: and
who also numbered the children of Israel; all the tribes of them, with the assistance of their princes:
in the plains of Moab, by Jordan, near Jericho; as they were commanded by the Lord.

children.text: in the plains of Moab, by Jordan, near Jericho; as they were commanded by the Lord.

elements.text: These are they that were numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest, who numbered the children of Israel in the plains of Moab by Jordan near Jericho.

name: Cambridge Bible for Schools and Colleges

elements.text: . An editorial conclusion to the census. Not a man was reckoned who had been alive at the first census, with the exception of Caleb and Joshua.
Numbers 26:63

name: Keil and Delitzsch Biblical Commentary on the Old Testament

elements.text: Concluding formula with the remark in
Numbers 26:65
, that the penal sentence which God had pronounced in
Numbers 14:29
and
Numbers 14:38
upon the generation which came out of Egypt, had been completely carried out.
